name: CODE_PHRASE
title: CODE_PHRASE
description: A fully coordinated (i.e. all coordination has been performed) term from a terminology service (as distinct from a particular terminology).

element.definition: A fully coordinated (i.e. all coordination has been performed) term from a terminology service (as distinct from a particular terminology).

constraint.human: Code string valid must not be empty

element.short: Identifier of the distinct terminology from which the code_string (or its elements) was extracted.
element.definition: Identifier of the distinct terminology from which the code_string (or its elements) was extracted.

element.short: The key used by the terminology service to identify a concept or coordination of concepts.
element.definition: The key used by the terminology service to identify a concept or coordination of concepts. This string is most likely parsable inside the terminology service, but nothing can be assumed about its syntax outside that context.

element.short: Optional attribute to carry preferred term corresponding to the code or expression in `_code_string_`.
element.definition: Optional attribute to carry preferred term corresponding to the code or expression in `_code_string_`. Typical use in integration situations which create mappings, and representing data for which both a (non-preferred) actual term and a preferred term are both required.
